review_title: One of the Best Jobs I've Ever Had!
pros: EXCELLENT benefits package, the best I've found anywhere. Lovely people who are passionate about what they do and care about making a difference in the community. Strong leadership. Really important mission that we proactively carry out, not just pay lip service to it. I was there before COVID but have watched ICHS rise to the challenge to test and vaccinate so many people. They worked hard to protect the community and we are grateful for it. HR cares about the employees. I miss my time there. A special place.
cons: When I was there it was really hard to find parking near the Seattle clinic.

pros: Good benefit, good insurance and holiday
cons: Lower salary and stress environment

pros: Depending on the clinic location, your coworkers will welcome you in and make you feel like family.
cons: Low paying. HR/Admin do not give a crap about all the work you do, they will always try to pay you less than you deserve. Somewhere along the way the organization lost their ways and cared more about profits than making sure their employees are happy. Annually they send out emails ensuring employees a raise but the raise is only a few cents! What a slap in the face. They consistently do not raise your pay at all.

pros: Great benefits, medical, dental, and vision.
cons: Great work-life balance. Organized well paid

review_title: Nepotism, horrible manager, many of middle managers.
pros:
Good benefits maybe.
Close to my house.
In china town, lunch is good.
cons:
Incompetent manager if you don't kiss her behind to her liking. She will make up rules to write you up and push you out. 
Many languages are spoken. they don't think it is rude to switch back and forth in a group of people.
pays are horrible and they think they pay you in gold.

review_title: Great community heath clinic to work at
pros: Smaller team, was able to learn from others.
cons: If you do not speak the dominate language spoken by most of the patients, it may be harder to communicate. Systems were pretty outdated

pros:
They try to put up a façade of happiness, community, peer support, and activism. I know it's not just me because I replaced a guy before me who only lasted there for less than a year. A fellow coworker also had to be let go.

If you like Asian coworkers and patients. I did enjoy working with a few particular clients. They have translators, but sometimes there isn't enough to go around. It's something that will hold you over until you get somewhere else. It's near downtown.
cons: If you want to work here - it will likely be short term - pay is poor, work volume and difficulty is high. A lot of MDs here, so you're walking on eggshells - which is probably common in these types of practices.

pros:
Experience with in person and phone triage
Having independence with your nurse visits
Providers are always helpful and available 
Great teamwork
cons:
Low compensation 
Company is more focused on money than their mission statement
Staff is overworked 
The company does not make you feel valued 
Your opinion does not matter

review_title: Great healthcare workers and mission but Administration is difficult to work with and has created a tough environment.
pros: Great mission, making a difference in community health care, wonderful healthcare providers who are very hard working.
cons: Administrative staff don't listen to health care workers and are disrespectful. Top-down style leadership and a lack of communication throughout the organization make it hard for anything to get done. Some managers are emotionally abusive and senior leadership has created a toxic work environment. The mission is admirable but the actual internal culture can be difficult depending on what department you are in.

job_title: Physician Assistant, PA-C in Seattle, WA
pros: The organization supports advanced practice clinicians
cons: Lower salary starting out based on experience

review_title: TOXIC and discriminating environment, micromanaged and controlled daily
job_title: Infection Prevention & Control Administrator in Seattle, WA
pros: - Located next to the freeway.
cons:
- This organization has a good mission, but they are just words at best. People don't truly follow it.

- The leadership and all the directors only have "titles" but nothing to show for, but they are unprofessional, disorganized, and aren't leaders at all.

- VERY TOXIC environment!! Beware. Employees (not in leadership) are treated like they are disposable.

- Managers are extremely CONTROLLING and like to micro-manage.

- Employees that don't speak Asian languages are discriminated against.

- Lots of gossip and bullying happen here.

- LOW PAY, way overworked. After working at ICHS for a long time, I never received a raise nor praised for the work that I did. I worked overtime often and was not compensated for it.

pros: a good place to work
cons: salary, workflow, environment, parking, management

job_title: Dental Front Desk in Seattle, WA
pros: This company is good for people who have 0% of job experience
cons: Lower salary than other company

pros: Get to be part of something helpful to the community
cons: medical insurance for dependence is expensive

review_title: Blatant favoritism, low performance standards, unhealthy work environment.  Look elsewhere.
pros: Like all federally qualified community health centers ICHS has a great mission to serve the underserved. Almost all clinical employees are dedicated to the patients.
cons: Several folks here have been promoted because they can talk a good game, not because they are capable of delivering results or would make good managers.  Most supervisors are home-grown with little training and even less guidance from their managers because their managers are not well-supported or trained either.  Management team meetings are dreaded, where top leadership openly puts managers down and prevents any constructive dialogue from taking place.  People literally get cut off as they're talking if they raise concerns or exhibit critical thinking.  There is a lack of conflict management or interpersonal skills amongst top leaders here.  Reliance on consultants with questionable ethics who have no health care experience does not help and planning and execution processes suffer because of this.

review_title: Unhealthy Work Environment: An Organization Full of Dissatisfied Employees
pros: Mission: to provide culturally and linguistically appropriate health services to improve the health of Asian Pacific Islanders and the broader community
cons:
-Disempowered employees: front line workers and managers alike feel disempowered (and are!) to make changes which would improve services delivered to patients and improve their staff work environment
-Out of touch upper management: upper management are out of touch with the day to day realities of their employees and the delivery of services and unwilling to listen and learn from employees
-Cultural tension and insensitivity: unfortunately, despite the mission of the organization to provide culturally appropriate health services, many of the health care staff are not culturally inclusive, competent, and sensitive.  Many of the health care staff are familiar with their country-specific cultural norms and work to respectfully provide care to people of their own culture/country but have A LOT of stereotypes (and unfortunately, many of them negative) about people who are not from their home culture/country.

review_title: If you want to succeed here, do exactly as you are told and don't question anything.
pros: This is a community health center that serves an underserved, low-income population.  The line staff is very mission-driven.  Employees care about the people they serve; they have a reason to come to work every day.  Employees want to do as much as they can for the community they serve. They work diligently to provide excellent health care.  Many people have learned how to work together to accomplish tasks and goals.
cons: Several re-organizations in the past few years have left everyone off balance.  Rumors flourish in the absence of information.  Many key people have left in the past year, leaving gaps that have not been filled. Differences of opinion are not well tolerated. People are interrupted when they are speaking in a meeting.  There is an atmosphere of fear and intimidation, which is not healthy.

pros: Patient comes first. I love that. Everyone believes in the Mission Statement and are dedicated in helping patients and each other. Very much so feels like a work family. When I come to work, I am happy to see my co-workers. Diversity is top of the line. You hear so many different languages. I love learning about different cultures.  Amazing benefits! No cost to the employee and crazy low deductible. I have never had better benefits in my working career. Great 403(b) contribution, regardless if you contribute or not.
cons: Most people complain about the pay. For a Community Health Clinic the pay is competitive with other Community Health Centers. What matters is the Mission. It is hard to hire employees who don't understand that Community Health will never pay as much as the private sector. We are Mission and Grants driven. We are not-for-profit.

review_title: If you are a strong leader who gets good results, take your talent somewhere else.
pros: There is a clear mission to serve the under-served and most people are dedicated and committed to serving their communities.
cons: There is, in several managers' opinions, poor leadership at the top which contributes to an unecessarily toxic organizational culture.  Dissent is not tolerated, even when it is in the best interest of future organizational success.  There is a clear culture of favoritism.  I have never worked at a place where so many people took credit for the work of others.  This is driven from the top.

review_title: Another FQHC with a high concentration of asian patients that don't speak english
pros:
Idealistic staff. Lots of interpreter support. It's located in downtown Seattle which is somewhat close to where I live and a lot of people live. Ability to serve a vulnerable community. There is some money allocated to continuing education, they cover a lot of work costs.

Pharmacy and pharmacist on site is nice and helpful.
cons:
High patient volume is required to maintain employment here. About 3 patients per hour is expected. The process for entering time sheets is strange and disorganized. HR is not well developed. Benefits were about par at best. Parking is hard to find, or you have to pay for parking. No free bus pass, just able to use a tax free account to buy bus passes. As within many large healthcare centers - there's a smorgasbord of different care providers with different egos, styles, and biases. If interpreters call out sick or the video interpreter machine doesn't work, your work gets a lot harder. Seems to try to stretch everyone. Supervisors are also overloaded, lots of geriatric patients here from the nursing home that is located near the clinic. Lot of complicated patients with cultural and language barriers here. 

Based on reviewing medical records of patients, the provider that I replaced was here for about 1 year before he left. I saw about 2-3 other names of people who used to work there. However, there are some people who have been around for a LONG time. As with many work environments, there's some politics as play, lots of ego.

It was hard because as I was getting credentialed, I had to have someone else sign off on my charts who was credentialed. The feedback was helpful at times, but it was just too much. Some of the providers disagreed with each other on the feedback. It just my life that much harder on top of everything else. 

I think a coworker I used to know has also left that place within the last few months. Midlevels seem to have an uphill battle here. They typically need locums for coverage. You have to get credentialed for everything and getting credentialed takes forever.

review_title: Take your talent somewhere else- blatant favoritism, extremely poor leadership, poor benefits and training
pros: Best reasons to work here if you want to work with underserved communities, especially large influx of minorities specific to each site. Most workers work very hard to keep the clinic running and are friendly but very gossipy.
cons:
- management- incompetent, unqualified, some make you wonder "don't know how they got there" 
-office culture: gossiping, favoritism within and between departments, poor and improperly routed communication.  
- high turnover rate in management and certain departments

review_title: Recently an employee got terminated due to poor customer service. I felt sorry for that employee.
pros: Good location, good food, convenient to everything.
cons:
some staff and departments should be eliminated due to funding, All funding are from the State, Federal and City as well as private Org. 
As a taxpayer, they should learn how to use the money wisely.

pros:
-Collaborative environment 
-I feel like I make a difference at ICHS
-Strong executive leadership
-Co-workers that care!
-Positive Work/Life balance
cons: Always room for improvement. This is the best place I've worked. No place is perfect. I have worked with different Community Health Centers in the Seattle area. This is by far the most collaborative and positive work environment I have experienced .

review_title: If you are competent, detest favoritism, enjoy respect and a healthy work environment, this is not the place for you.
pros: The organization provides healthcare to an underserved community and has a great mission statement.  Many of the employees are dedicated to the patients.
cons: Since I have been here, there have been at least four re-organizations.  Top management does not understand how to effectively run and manage a health care organization.  Some of the very best managers have been either treated so poorly they have left, or have been terminated for reasons that are either unclear or wrongful.  Or they have been re-orged out of the organization because of the many changes in the management structure.  I have never seen a management team turnover this high in any organization I have worked in.  Original ideas are not accepted and there is no possibility of meaningful discussions or raising legitimate concerns.  Top management cuts people off in mid-sentence and is very disrespectful so therefore, there is a general feeling of dislike and disrespect throughout the organization.  What is left is a management team that is afraid to talk in meetings, afraid to lead and afraid to challenge poor ideas and leadership.

review_title: Not recommend to work here if you don't speak their languages.
pros: It's a good position if you wanna start your medical career here. Also, the location is convenient which is close to Chinatown and downtown area.
cons: Most workers speak English as second language. Patients are mostly immigrants, not able to communicate in English. It's not surprised to see new providers, because most providers hard to keep in the clinic for work for some reasons.

review_title: No longer a mouse looking for cheese
job_title: Patient Services Supervisor in Bellevue, WA
pros: As a new hire, I received a great mentor to help me transition into my role.  I believed this has help me excel in my role. I enjoy using the open lines of communication. In previous roles with other systems, it hard to hear your voice.
cons: More staff discounts to attend community events would be nice like the Passport Unlimited discount card.

pros: We have best Lead in our team , Phuong To , she is awesome team leader in ICHS , I like working with her, she melt my heart and let me feel I am with family all the time in ICHS, she care of every team member also help us to improve our working skills.
cons: We have many task needs to be taking care during the working time, it made us feel always short-staff.

job_title: Community Health Specialist in Seattle, WA
pros: People are really nice, decently organized for a non-profit organization, very good benefits and PTO accrual
cons: Departments don't communicate well with each other. Often employees don't know what other teams do.

review_title: Excellent employer with a mission-driven focus
pros: Amazing benefits, wonderful coworkers, an incredible community of patients, and a focus on comprehensive primary care that integrates several disciplines so we can best serve our patients and their communities.
cons: The patient population has the potential to be complex which can be hard for some providers but it is incredibly rewarding work and this reality overshadows the challenges.

pros: It has a welcoming culture and high inclusivity. you will feel heard and cared for.  ICHS serves the community and I feel that I am having a positive impact on a daily basis.
cons: You need to be flexible to match the needs of the community. It is perfect for me but it may not be the case for everyone.

pros: Great place to work if you truly have a passion to help those in the community and want to be surrounded by diversity.
cons: Lack of communication throughout the whole clinic, and lack of qualified supervisors.

pros: You get health benefit and join 403k from the company. That's a good thing
cons: Bad management, departments are divided in groups and talk bad things about other groups.

pros: A great environment for languages and culture diversity. Serving elder and low-income people are great chance for those who follow non-profit and social jobs
cons: You have to deal with many patients who has languages barrier

pros: Love how diverse the community is, here at ICHS, I definitely love seeing new faces everyday and being able to help one another.
cons: I don't have any downsides of working at ICHS

pros: Great Company to Work for
cons: none I can think of

pros: Mission driven and great benefits!
cons: Commute time and cost of parking!
